record.title: ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, JULY 31, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, JULY 31, 2007 -- (Senate - July 30, 2007)

[Page: S10338]

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 10 a.m. Tuesday, July 31; that on Tuesday, following the prayer and the pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, and the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day; that there then be a period of morning business for 60 minutes, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each, with the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees, with the Republicans controlling the first half and the majority controlling the final half; that at the close of morning business, all time postcloture be considered yielded back and the

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
